textBox.richText: “On the Vulnerability of Finger Vein Recognition to Spoofing”, Pedro Tome, Matthias Vanoni and Sébastien Marcel. The vulnerability of finger vein recognition to spoofing is studied in this paper. A collection of spoofing finger vein images has been created from real finger vein samples. Finger vein images are printed using a commercial printer and then, presented at an open source finger vein sensor. Experiments are carried out using an extensible framework, which allows fair and reproducible benchmarks. Experimental results lead to a spoofing false accept rate of 86%, thus showing that finger vein biometrics is vulnerable to spoofing attacks, pointing out the importance to investigate countermeasures against this type of fraudulent actions. Video: http://www.idiap.ch/technology-transfer/demonstrations/spoofing-finger-vein-recognition Paper available here: http://publications.idiap.ch/index.php/publications/show/2910 Software: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/xbob.paper.BIOSIG2014
Paper on Finger Vein spoofing at BioSig 2014
